question: Fred’s blood was determined to be AB positive. What does this mean?
options: antibodies to A and B are present in the erythrocytes
there are no antibodies to A, to B , or to Rh antigens in the plasma
answer: there are no antibodies to A, to B , or to Rh antigens in the plasma

options: it is found in both ICF and ECF
the differences between plasma and ICF is their protein concentration

question: Normal human red cells
options: are released into circulation as immature cells called reticulocytes
rely on mitochondria for their ATP production
answer: are released into circulation as immature cells called reticulocytes

question: Regarding the platelets:
options: are present in greater number than red cells
will adhere to the walls of damaged blood vessels
is the last cellular response for bleeding
will adhere to the walls of damaged blood vessels
answer: are present in greater number than red cells

question: Regarding inflammatory response
options: tissue swelling is the fist stage of inflammatory response
mast cells secrete chemotactic agents that attract lymphocytes
macrophages secrete vasoactive materials during inflammatory response
the inflammatory response can be triggered by antibody binding to the surface of microorganism
answer: tissue swelling is the fist stage of inflammatory response

question: Regarding the natural immune system
options: neutrophils only destroy bacteria circulating in the blood
macrophages use nitrous oxide to kill bacteria they have engulfed
complement kills bacteria prior to their uptake by phagocytes
the monocytes of the blood are the precursors of tissue macrophages
the monocytes of the blood are the precursors of immunity
answer: the monocytes of the blood are the precursors of tissue macrophages

question: Regarding the lymphocytes
options: the lymphocytes are the most abundant white cells of the blood
lymphocytes only leave the blood at sites of inflammation
B lymphocytes respond to antigens in the extracellular fluid
all T lymphocytes become plasma cells after they have been stimulated
answer: B lymphocytes respond to antigens in the extracellular fluid

question: Regarding the functions of T lymphocytes:
options: T lymphocytes mature in the thyroid gland
all T cells secrete cytotoxic materials
T- cells respond to proteins on the surface of host cells
answer: T- cells respond to proteins on the surface of host cells

question: About antibodies
options: The antigen receptor on a lymphocyte has the same specificity as the antibody it secretes

group A blood is transfused to a group AB person

question: The conversion of fibrinogen to fibrin
options: is promoted by prothrombin , a proteolytic enzyme
involves the disruption of certain peptide linkages in fibrinogen
is not inhibited by heparin, a strong electronegative substance
answer: involves the disruption of certain peptide linkages in fibrinogen

question: Thirst is
options: produced by a fall in plasma tonicity when though blood volume is normal
produced by rise in blood volume even though blood tonicity is normal

question: Erythropoiesis
options: is stimulated when a person descends to a height where the atmospheric pressure is doubled
occurs only in the bone marrow
is dependent on normal gastric secretory activity
is stimulated by a rise in the pressure of carbondioxide (PCO₂) in the arterial blood
answer: is stimulated by a rise in the pressure of carbondioxide (PCO₂) in the arterial blood

are derived from the bone marrow
flow in the main axial stem of blood
answer: are derived from the bone marrow

question: Antibodies

answer: which circulate as free immunoglobulins are produced by the B-lymphocytes

question: Bleeding from a small cut in the skin
options: is normally diminished in normal people
ceases within 5 minutes in normal people
would prolong if factor VIII is absent
is likely to be greater if the skin is cold than if it is warm
none of the above is correct
answer: would prolong if factor VIII is absent

question: Bilirubin
options: tissues from red cell breakdown sites to the liver dissolved in plasma in an unbound form

is a porphyrin pigment derived from haem
answer: is necessary for digestion and absorption of fat in the intestine

question: Thrombocytes are important in stopping bleeding that

answer: when exposed to collagen they become active and loose
